actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Committee on Judiciary. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.
Committee on Judiciary. Reported to Senate by Senator Thurmond with an amendment. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 480.
Indefinitely postponed by Senate by Voice Vote.

official_title: A bill to preserve the authority of the Supreme Court Police to provide protective services for Justices and Court personnel.

summary.text: (Reported to Senate from the Committee on the Judiciary with amendment (without written report)) Extends for one year after enactment of this Act the authority of the Supreme Court Police and the Marshal of the Supreme Court to protect the Chief Justice, Justices, official guests, officers, and employees of the Supreme Court. Directs the Marshal of the Supreme Court to report to the Congress annually regarding the administrative costs of carrying out such duties.

titles.title: A bill to preserve the authority of the Supreme Court Police to provide protective services for Justices and Court personnel.
